steps.text: After turkey is done cooking, leave the drippings in the roasting pan and place it over medium heat.
Add the chicken stock and red wine, whisking to combine, and scraping the bottom of the pan until the bits have come loose.
Cook 2-3 minutes to reduce mixture slightly.
Transfer liquid to a fat separator and let sit for 5 minutes to allow fat to separate.
Return 2/3 - 3/4 of the fat to the roasting pan and place over medium-high heat. Discard remaining fat.
Add the flour and whisk to combine.
Cook, whisking continuously, until the mixture starts to thicken and become smooth, approximately 2-3 minutes.
Gradually add the liquid back to the pan and whisk until smooth and it has reached your desired consistency (approximately 5-6 minutes). It will continue to thicken as it sits.
Add herbs and whisk to combine. Season with salt and pepper.
